revision_history.draft:
The rain etches its code into plastic veins—  
a language of erosion, soft and persistent,  
unspooling the static of forgotten  
graffiti from concrete ribs.  
Neon signs flicker, their hues bleeding  
into the puddles’ slow digestion of light,  
while rusted pipes exhale their last  
whispers through cracks in the pavement’s  
skin.  
Here, memory is not preserved but  
scoured away—  
the circuit board’s brittle hymn,  
the asphalt’s crusted tongue,  
all dissolving into the dark’s  
unrelenting appetite.

The rain carves its cipher into plastic arteries—  
a tongue of erosion, relentless and patient,  
unraveling the static of forgotten  
graffiti from concrete bones.  
Neon signs flicker, their hues dissolving  
into the puddles’ slow consumption of light,  
while rusted pipes exhale their final lament  
through fissures in the pavement’s weathered skin.  
Here, memory is not archived but  
eroded—  
the circuit board’s fractured hymn,  
the asphalt’s crusted tongue,  
all melting into the dark’s  
insatiable hunger.

final_poem:
The rain carves its cipher into plastic veins—  
a tongue of erosion, relentless and patient,  
unraveling the static of forgotten  
graffiti from concrete bones.  
Neon signs flicker, their hues dissolving  
into the puddles’ slow devouring of light,  
while rusted pipes exhale their final lament  
through fissures in the pavement’s weathered skin.  
Here, memory is not archived but  
eroded—  
the circuit board’s fractured hymn,  
the asphalt’s crusted tongue,  
all melting into the dark’s  
insatiable maw.
